intro: Lasiandra echinata, commonly known as the spiny lomatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough or hairy texture. Lasiandra echinata is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
